newsitem.title: INDONESIA: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Indonesian newspapers - April 7.

text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Indonesian press on April 7. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

The leader of the Moslem-oriented United Development Party (PPP) Ismail Hasan Metareum has said recent public appearances by the head of Indonesia's largest Moslem group the Nahdlatul Ulama, Abdurrachman Wahid, with figures from the ruling Golkar party was an effort to deflate the PPP's vote in the May general elections.

Manpower Minister Abdul Latief has said the government will consider companies' requests for postponements in the granting of newly increased minimum wages only if they first solicit the consent of their workers.
Fresh unrest erupted in the Central Java town of Pekalongan on Sunday leaving several stores damaged as an apparent follow-on from politically motivated rioting two weeks ago.

Mines and Energy Minister Ida Bagus Sudjana is set to remove three senior officials on Monday in a move that many say is heavily influenced by the fallout from the Busang gold mine controversy. - - - -

President Suharto's youngest son Hutomo Mandala Putra will marry Raden Ayu Ardhia Pramesti Rigita Chayani, a descendant of Javanese royalty, on April 30. Mandala Putra is the only one of Suharto's six children yet unmarried.
